}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:01.279
    | text      = What's that?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:01.759
    | text      = Holy shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:02.799
    | text      = Bill Clinton's coming back.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:03.840
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:05.120
    | text      = I didn't talk about a story that broke a couple days ago.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:08.480
    | text      = Bill Clinton said he wanted to get rid of the 22nd amendment
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:12.080
    | text      = so he can run again.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:14.720
    | text      = But Republicans have introduced bills as well.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:18.080
    | text      = So the princeling, George W from Kenny Buckport, Maine,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:23.440
    | text      = can run again.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:24.559
    | text      = For those in our audience outside the United States,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:26.879
    | text      = the 22nd amendment was added to the Constitution in 1947,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:30.720
    | text      = essentially to make sure that someone could only serve
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:33.519
    | text      = two four-year terms as president.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:35.600
    | text      = Prior to this, it was just kind of understood
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:37.360
    | text      = that this was the norm, with George Washington
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:39.279
    | text      = setting an unwritten precedent by not seeking
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:41.200
    | text      = a third term in office.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:42.879
    | text      = This amendment was ratified when it was, in 1947,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:45.679
    | text      = because the presidency of Franklin Roosevelt
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:47.679
    | text      = had just ended, who served three terms
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:49.679
    | text      = and had won a fourth election for the presidency
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:51.840
    | text      = but died in office.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:52.799
    | text      = People kind of realized at that point that this norm
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:55.039
    | text      = that everyone just assumed everyone would accept
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:57.200
    | text      = was not actually a rule and maybe we should put it on paper.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:01.039
    | text      = We've kind of learned some more of those things lately.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:03.440
    | text      = It was called the Calm It Down Roosevelt Amendment.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:06.480
    | text      = That was the first name of it, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:08.080
    | text      = Since then, presidents have been bound by these term limits,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:10.559
    | text      = although the wording of the rules has often caused
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:12.720
    | text      = some debate to pop up.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:14.480
    | text      = For instance, conversations often happen about whether
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:17.039
    | text      = a two-term president could run for a third consecutive term
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:19.759
    | text      = if they were vice president on the third term.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:22.159
    | text      = Sure, sure, sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:24.159
    | text      = Bill Clinton was speculating that it might be a good idea
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:26.879
    | text      = to allow someone who served two consecutive terms
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:29.200
    | text      = to run again at a later date,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:31.360
    | text      = essentially making the term limits only apply
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:33.440
    | text      = to the consecutive terms.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:34.960
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:35.519
    | text      = He was giving speech at the, probably not a coincidence,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:38.799
    | text      = John F. Kennedy Library and Museum in Boston,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:41.840
    | text      = where he speculated that given that people were living longer,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:44.639
    | text      = quote, there may come a time when we elect a president
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:47.360
    | text      = at age 45 or 50, and then 20 years later the country
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:50.639
    | text      = comes up against the same kind of problems
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:52.399
    | text      = the president faced before.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:54.480
    | text      = So that's basically, you know...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:57.600
    | text      = He's at the John F. Kennedy Library.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:59.600
    | text      = Right, right, right, right, right.

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:49.859
    | text      = Because that was sort of what I was going to explain last.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

    | timestamp = 00:24:06.900
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:07.299
    | text      = And the Democrat ended up winning the election.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:10.900
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:16.579
    | text      = That the Republican would have won the seat.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:18.819
    | text      = But based on the percentages, I don't think that's the case.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:25.460

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:36.980
    | text      = I think that that's the only way that I can look back and make sense of this.

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:41.460
    | text      = And I think that's probably what he's talking about.

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:43.460

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:44.980
    | text      = And he would almost view it probably as like a trade of like...
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:48.099
    | text      = Something like that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:48.579
    | text      = Florida got the president, so they got the Senate.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:51.059
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:52.259
    | text      = Not all Senate elections stick out in your memory, but 2000 was special.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:56.500
    | text      = It sure was.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:58.019
    | text      = That was the election where John Ashcroft lost the Missouri Senate race to Mel Carnahan,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:02.099
    | text      = who had actually died prior to the election.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:04.660
    | text      = As someone who was in Missouri at the time, this was gratifying for me,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:07.779
    | text      = because I hated John Ashcroft as an asshole.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:10.019
    | text      = He was a piece of shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:11.140
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:11.700
    | text      = After the 2000 Senate elections, the vote was tied 50-50,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:15.059
    | text      = with the vice president casting the tie-breaking vote.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:17.859
    | text      = Then, in June 2001, Jim Jeffords, previously a Republican, decided to go independent,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:23.059
    | text      = and he started to caucus with the Democrats.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:25.859
    | text      = In a book he would later release, Jeffords explained that he began to feel alienated by the GOP,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:30.740
    | text      = particularly in their refusal to support and fund the Individuals with Disabilities Act,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:34.980
    | text      = which had been a major priority of his for at least, like, decades before this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:39.859
    | text      = I'll read to you here from a statement that he released after he decided to switch parties.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:44.259
    | text      = Quote,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:44.900
    | text      = Increasingly, I find myself in disagreement with my party.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:47.700
    | text      = I understand that many people are more conservative than I am,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:50.420
    | text      = and they form the Republican Party.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:52.259
    | text      = Given the changing nature of the National Party,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:54.180
    | text      = it's become a struggle for our leaders to deal with me, and for me to deal with them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:25:58.339
    | text      = Indeed, the party's electoral success has underscored the dilemma I face within my party.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:03.059
    | text      = In the past, without the presidency,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:04.819
    | text      = the various wings of the Republican Party and Congress have had some freedom to argue,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:08.740
    | text      = and ultimately to shape the party's agenda.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:11.220
    | text      = The election of President Bush changed that dramatically.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:14.099
    | text      = We don't live in a parliamentary system,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:16.339
    | text      = but it's only natural to expect that people such as myself,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:19.299
    | text      = who have been honored with positions of leadership,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:21.140
    | text      = will largely support the president's agenda.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:23.619
    | text      = Looking ahead, I can see more and more instances
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:26.019
    | text      = where I will disagree with the president on very fundamental issues.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:29.460
    | text      = The issues of choice, the direction of the judiciary,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:32.180
    | text      = tax and spending decisions, missile defense,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:34.500
    | text      = energy and the environment,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:35.619
    | text      = and a host of other issues large and small.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:37.859
    | text      = The largest for me is education,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:39.779
    | text      = which loops back to the Individuals with Disability Act issues that he was very passionate about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:45.940
    | text      = You can make an argument that there was like some backroom dealing involved,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:48.900
    | text      = because duh.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:49.940
    | text      = After he switched parties and gave the Democrats a slight advantage in terms of votes,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:53.380
    | text      = he was given the chairmanship of the Senate Environment and Public Works Committee,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:26:57.220
    | text      = but he could also kind of make the argument that this was making up for the chairmanship
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:00.740
    | text      = that he would necessarily lose when he leaves the Republican Party,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:04.180
    | text      = that he had held for a long time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:05.700
    | text      = Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:06.420
    | text      = So I don't know, I don't know, like that doesn't feel staged to me.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:11.220
    | text      = I don't see anyone admitting it,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:38.099
    | text      = That's nice.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:27:38.740
    | text      = Oh, also one more note about that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock

    | timestamp = 00:27:40.900
    | text      = Ultimately none of this matters at all,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

}}

{{TranscriptBlock

    | timestamp = 00:27:46.980

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
